reviewText: I love this workout!  I thought I was in great shape.  I ride my bike, I swim, I do spin class, I do 45 minutes on the eliptical at the hardest setting, I do yoga, and I do pilates.  None of that prepared me for Tae Bo.  I was wiped out at the end of the tape.  What really amazed me is what a great ab work out it is.My only complaint is that you need a lot of room to move.  Be sure to clear a big space for this video.An earlier reviewer complained that everyone was sweaty.  Maybe I'm weird but I think it appealing.  Plus, there's no way you could do this workout without sweating a lot.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Man, I would give this 4 1/2 stars, if I could.  The Tae bo "Get Ripped" advanced workouts got me to my pre-pregnancy shape & beyond back in 2005 and I'm using them now to get rid of the extra 10 pounds that I carelessly let slip by me this winter. It's only been a week & I've lost 1 1/2 lbs from this advanced tape (3x a week along with my usual 3x a week power yoga)! The "Get Ripped" dvd is my go to workouts when I need to get in shape fast! There's something about this particular dvd that does it for me. I love kickboxing but this is outrageous! The only reason I don't give it a full 5 stars is the usually uneven counting Billy Blanks is notoriously known for. I try to even them out somehow.I've been thinking about getting the "Get Ripped" basic dvd just to have a shorter version on hand for those days my energy is not up there but I'm afraid I might not work out to my full capacity.  All in all, Tae bo "Get Ripped" advanced is my workout for fast, consistent results. There is no other more intense Tae bo out there- not even the newer ones! I will no longer neglect my kickboxing/Tae bo again!
summary: Awesome workout- gets the job done!

reviewText: I have been doing TaeBo 3-5 times a week for about 5 years now, and purchased this DVD when it first came out a few years ago to add variety. I still love it and use it regularly. They are absolutely my favorite workouts!The two routines on this DVD were challenging, even after having mastered the advanced one from the first series, and that's why I like them so much. Although it's easier now, I still burn so many calories that I can eat fast food and chocolate (and I do, quite often) without gaining weight. My upper arms don't wiggle at all, thanks to the speedbag move. I can keep up with my kids, I can ski and rollerblade without being out of breath, and I can wear trendy, lowcut jeans without bulges of fat. Pretty good for an ordinary mom in her forties, and all thanks to this TaeBo DVD.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I like doing the 8-minute workout in the mornings before work (it's really a 16 minute workout).  Billy has some funny sayings that he repeats over and over and that keeps me chuckling as I work out.  It's a fun DVD to have.  Taebo helps to loosen my muscles and keep me fit.  You'll notice that Billy screws up some of the moves himself and that adds to the humor.  Most of the time instead of doing the workout moves, he's telling the people behind him to "Touch My Hand" and "Don't Bounce" and "Jab, jab, jab, jab" over and over and over.  It's a bit annoying at times, but I learn to live with it.

reviewText: Having moved to a cold place, I've become a fanatic about the workout videos.  The Firm is great, Buns of Steel is even better - but Billy?  Tops 'em all!  This is my first time doing Tae Bo, but I am extremely active (workout 6 hours a week) and that has included a lot of kickboxing classes at the gym and tae kwon do in my past.  So far, I have only done Workout 1 out of the two, and it was great.  I didn't have any trouble following along, but as others have said, if you're a beginner, this is probably not the way you want to start.  I have been searching high and low for a solid one-hour workout at home.  I've finally found it.  Nothing beats the way I felt after this tape.  Elite Forces barely had me sweating, and even the Firm (Total Body Sculpting Basics) has not been cutting it lately.  With this tape, I was sweating and my heartrate was high the entire time.  By sweating, I mean dripping buckets - a sign of an awesome workout.  I was able to finish it even on the first time, but it was definitely a major challenge.  It's the first time I've been able to feel the way I do in BodyCombat classes at the gym without leaving my house!  I highly recommend this tape, but be careful if you've got knee or back issues - if it's your first time doing this kind  of exercise, take a couple of classes at a gym first to learn proper form.  Enjoy!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I just purchased this DVD and boy do I wish I'd had it sooner.  I have been doing the original advanced and a few of the live series advanced for years and was really getting bored with them.  I also do cardio kickboxing classes at the gym, step aerobics, weight lifting and spinning, so I consider myself to be in shape.  This DVD gave me a challenging new working to keep me interested again.There are two workouts on this DVD.  The first one is by far the better of the two.  This one is 55 minutes and you don't go to the floor - which I appreciate.  I would rather do an hour of mostly cardio and do my own floorwork afterwards.  I don't really need anyone to lead me through that.  The music is okay, and there are a few cueing issues, howevever I love it!  I was able to do the whole thing, although once or twice I did hit pause to catch my breath.The 2nd workout on this DVD is also 55 minutes, however there is more downtime between moves and at the end you go to the floor to do a short set of leg lifts.  There was one move where you punch left, punch right, and then twist your feet back and forth three times that I felt was a little odd feeling.  Another new move that I found extremely difficult was alternating lunges and kicks.  My buns were sooooo sore after doing this.  I won't use this workout as much because I don't necessarily want to work my buns this way daily.I just ordered the Billy's BootCamp series and am looking forward to new challenges.  If you are an advanced tae-boer, you definitely need to have this DVD in your collection.  I have only done it a few times but my core already feels more solid.  Thanks Billy!!!!!
summary: Wish I had found this DVD sooner!

reviewText: Buyers beware: "Tae Bo II: Get Ripped Advanced" is not for newbies!  If you're just starting out, pick up the original 4-pack, start with the Instructional video, move on to the Basic and Advanced workouts once you have the moves down, and don't even think about buying "Tae Bo II: Get Ripped Advanced" until you can do the Advanced workout without feeling nauseous or faint!  It took me six months to graduate from the Basic to the Advanced workout (yes, I was SERIOUSLY out of shape!), and another three months of doing the Advanced workout before I gave "Tae Bo II: Get Ripped Advanced" a go.  Even then, it kicked my butt.  I've been doing it for about six months now, and I LOVE it!"Tae Bo II: Get Ripped Advanced" features two great 55-minute workouts - Tae Bo II: Get Ripped Advanced 1 and Tae Bo II: Get Ripped Advanced 2 (these naming schemes are starting to get confusing, no?).  Each is extremely fast-paced and neither leaves you much time to catch your breath in between segments.  This is a good thing - the more exercises they can cram into the DVD, the further my dollar goes.  Plus, there's always the pause button if you start to get winded to the point of nausea.I went from 140 to 120 pounds while doing the original Basic and Advanced workouts (just for reference, I'm female and a shorty at 5'4").  By the time I started the Get Ripped series, I definitely wasn't overweight, but I wanted better muscle tone - and Get Ripped delivered!  Since I started this DVD, I've lost an additional 10 pounds and have developed good-sized biceps and surprisingly strong legs.  Though you won't get as ripped as Shellie, Debbie, and Michelle (hey, they all weight train, too!), you will see a difference.As an added bonus, there's also a 8-minute power workout included.  Actually, it really runs 15-minutes - there's a 7-minute warmup that for some reason isn't factored into the total running time.My main gripe with this TB DVD is the same as always - Billy sometimes neglects to repeat an exercise the same number of times on each side.  This can of course be remedied by alternating your starting side so that one day your left side does more work, the next day your right side gets more reps, and so on.  Otherwise, an awesome workout!
summary: Take your Tae Bo workout to the next level!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've done Taebo on and off for many years, but recently got back into it a couple months after my daughter was born (18 month ago).  I started off slow, but for the last year I've been doing his more advanced workouts.  I'd say I workout to Taebo about three to four times a week.  Needless to say, it doesn't matter how much Taebo I do, this video challenges me every time.  There are days where it takes every last ounce of me to get through it.  There is no letting up in this video so take a lot of deep breaths before you start because there will be no time for that until after the workout is over.  I do this on days when I want to burn a lot (and I stress a lot) of calories.  It's a great intense workout!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: GET THIS DVD...You will burn at least 1000 calories once you master the moves and can HANG until the end!!!  If you do this DVD at least 4 times a week YOU WILL SEE IMPROVEMENT within 30 days, hands down.  I give it 4 stars because of the off beat counting at times, but with Blanks new DVD Tae-Bo Cardio, much of this has been addressed and cleared up.  You will workout and feel it, but at the end it is worth it.  Also, KNOW THE TECHNIQUE before purchasing this DVD.  If you do not, I advise to get the original Tae-Bo or Tae-Bo Live DVD's.  These DVD's have the instructional section which will walk you through the technique.  Many have complained of knee injury etc., remember when you kick you raise your thigh and extend your leg, do not just throw it out there, this is where injuries occur.  And again, it is important to know the technique before jumping into any of the workouts, including the basic format.
summary: IF YOU WANT TO BURN THE CALORIES FAST...

reviewText: I have been workin out for 6 months now on and off with Billy Blanks' First set of workouts ("Begginers, Intermediate and Advanced Workout").  I have now been only using the advanced segment for the last 2 months and I felt it was gettin a little boring. So, I looked on amazon and I found this Get Ripped Advanced Workout hoping I would be able to Follow it. I had no problem following Billy on both Advanced segments which are an hour each!! You definately feel the burn and sweat your butt off with these!! Also, I found that it was comforting that the first workout doesn't involve floor work, but the next day I DID FEEL THE BURN ON THE SIDES OF MY ABS...WITHOUT FLOOR WORK!! This DVD is totally worth the money and you can alternate between his old DVD and this one! There's also an 8 minutes section that's a killer!! Buy it now! I was really surprised!!  =)
summary: This DVD is Even Better than His First  Advanced DVD!!!

reviewText: Advance I and II are very challenging. The choreography could be better, he jumps from one move on the left side of the body to another move (different/modified) on the right side of the body. However you can easily adjust to the routine, for example, I simply repeat the same move on the right side, so I am exercising both sides equally. Then next time around, I will do the "modified" version on both sides equally.Also I am not a big fan of the soundtrack on the second work out.
summary: Tough workout, but needs some production improvements

reviewText: I have been very disappointed in the exercise dvds I have purchased lately and decided to see if Amazon had dvd of an old VHS workout I fondly remembered having great success with and to my delight I found it.  This is CLASSIC Tae bo with two 50 min plus classes.  Advanced 1 is the hardest of the two classes and is all standing and will have you dripping with sweat.  The first time I did it again I really lost steam the last 20 minutes and was not giving it my all and according to my heart rate monitor I still burned 850 calories in 58 minutes.  Imagine what I could do it I went full steam and wore 3lb gloves!  Advanced 2 is easier than 1 and I would suggest starting with it.  The class has 6 minute warm-up and around 8 minutes of floor work at the end.  I did not do the floorwork and burned around 700 calories.  Instead of the floor work I did the 8 minute Workout which is actually 15 minutes.  Combined with Advanced 2 I worked out total of 60 minutes and burned 1,000 calories! Even though one of the workouts is easier than the other, I would not recommend this for people new to Tae Bo since it moves really fast and there is minimal break down.  I would start with "This is Taebo" or "Tae Bo Classic" for newbies.  But if you have Tae Bo or Cardio Kick Boxing experience then you can not beat this oldie but goodie to really rack up those calories.
summary: An Oldie but an exceptional Goodie

reviewText: This is by far the best workout video I have ever done!!  It is definitely not for beginners to Tae Bo or exercise in general, but if you feel ready for a challenge, you will not be disappointed in this video.  Video 1 is harder than video 2, but both give a thorough cardio and toning workout.  Billy is an inspiring instructor, and will keep you going until the end.  Tae bo has gotten me into the best shape of my life, and this set of workouts definitely has pushed me up to the next level of fitness.
